front.reference:
International Journal of Modern Physics A
Vol. 30, No. 3 (2015) 1530016 (50 pages)
front.address: Nikhef, Science Park 105, 1098 XG Amsterdam, The Netherlands
front.div:
Perhaps the most important way string theory has affected the perspective of particle
physics phenomenology is through the " string theory landscape " . We discuss the ev-
idence supporting its existence, describe the regions of the landscape that have been
explored, and examine what the string theory landscape might imply for most Standard
Model problems.
front.reference:
* Also published in " Perspectives on String Phenomenology " , edited by B. Acharya, G. L. Kane
and P. Kumar (World Scientific, 2015), pp. 155–217.

byline.affiliation: † Nikhef, Amsterdam; IMAPP, Radboud Universiteit Nijmegen;
